intro: Aethionema buxbaumii, commonly known as the Desert Cabbage, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North Africa and the Middle East. It is a low-growing, perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features small, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and bloom in spring. Aethionema buxbaumii is adapted to survive in poor soils and extreme temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
